channel.title: Just a quick question
channel.description: Hey everyone this might be against the rules but i was wondering how to use one item on another - to make it into another item, would anyone be able to help me out please?

item.title: Just a quick question
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

I just skimmed through ‘itemUsed’ through FigmentScape client class and found something like this

if(itemUsed == 233 && useWith == 237) { deleteItem(237, getItemSlot(237), 1); addItem(235, 1); }
Look for something like that make a copy, and deleteItem(273 getItemSlot(237), 1); is the part where it will remove the item that you used #233 on, and addItem(235, 1); is what item will be added, an amount of 1 #235s will be added to the inventory.

^Yea I didn’t notice JordieScape posted help I didn’t bother to read the posts made before me.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a quick question
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

The item on item packet. Search for ‘case 53:’. Here is an example of what to use:

if(((itemUsed == 3046) && (otherItem == 3046))){ deleteItem(3046, getItemSlot(3046), 1); deleteItem(3046, getItemSlot(3046), 1); addItem(3044, 1); addItem(229, 1); sendMessage("You have combined the liquid into 2 doses."); }

Read full topic

item.title: Just a quick question
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

I’m tired right now and haven’t coded for a while, but there should be a method for item on item if I’m not mistaken. It should be like

Playeritem (“1000, 1”) onPlayeritem (“1001, 1”) or something like that. Don’t take me straight on for that, but that’s kinda to put you on track. Since nobody else is on really to help.

Read full topic
